entry.title: Re: FORM 27EQ - TCS POSTING KEY
entry.content:
Hi @Moni123 

Not sure you were able to locate the desired answer, therefore providing the following updates.

From your description, the TCS posting using condition type JGTC tied to withholding tax type Y6 posting the tax amount as a debit (Posting Key 40) is not the typical or correct posting for TCS in SAP. Tax Collected at Source represents a liability and is usually posted as a credit with Posting Key 50, which matches your observation when using the standard TCS tax codes (JH and JI).

The recommended and supported approach is to use SAP’s standard TCS tax codes (JH - Final TCS and JI - Interim TCS) in your sales documents. These are configured for statutory compliance, post tax as a credit, and enable the remittance challan generation and reporting to work correctly, including the FORM 27EQ.

Please note, In SAP Public Cloud, changing posting keys for standard tax postings is typically not supported, so the best path is to align your condition types and tax codes with SAP’s delivered TCS setup.

Please review your configuration and switch to or align with the standard TCS tax codes for your TCS postings. This should resolve the error "No unpaid Tax item exists" and enable smooth remittance challan and FORM 27EQ reporting.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Customer Checkout cloud edition - Create technical user
entry.content:
This blog post describes how to create a client id and client secret (technical user) for PoS connection and technical communication for SAP Customer Checkout, cloud edition.

Prerequisite:

  • Access to SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition
  • Access to SAP Cloud Identity Services

Create client id and client secret

1. Go to SAP Customer Checkout manager -> Configuration

 

2. Navigate to About. The tenant administration URL is shown. Click on the link to navigate to SAP Cloud Identity Services Dashboard

 

3.  You are now redirected to the Dashboard of SAP Cloud Identity Services. Click on Applications

 

4. In the applications list you should "SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition"

 

5. To get a client id and client secret, a child app is needed. Click on Create

 

6. Select "SAP Customer Checkout, cloud edition" as parent application

 

7. Select your newly created child application. Click on "Dependencies"

 

8. Click on "Add" to create new dependencies

 

9. Select Dependency Name "ccom" - Application "SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition" - API "ccom"

 

10. Validate that a new dependency was created.  Click on "Client Authentication"

 

11. Click on "Add" to create a client id and client secret

 

12. Select "OpenID" and create the secret

 

13. Client id and client secret was successfully created

Use the client id and client secret in SAP Customer Checkout or your 3RD-Party integration.

CCO setup

The hostname for CCO can be found in Configuration -> General tab -> API URL in SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition.

Use the client id and client secret to connect CCO with your SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition.
IAS dependency name must must match with the dependency name specified in Step 9

3RD-Party integration

To implement 3RD-Party integrations with SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition you have to use the OAuth 2.0 Client Credential flow. The token endpoint can be found in the Configuration About tab.

Host
Can be found in Configuration -> About
https://*******.accounts.ondemand.com/oauth2/token

Basic Auth

Username**************************** (client id)
Password **************************** (client secret)

URL Parameter

grant_typeclient_credentials
client_id**************************** (client id)
resourceurn:sap:identity:application:provider:name:ccom

The last part "ccom" must match with the dependency name specified in Step 9

More Info about client credentials flow and SAP Cloud Identity services
https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/configure-client-to-call-identity-authentication-token-endpoint-for-client-credentials-flow?locale=en-US 
https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/quick-start-dependent-applications?locale=en-US 

Documentation SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition

SAP Customer Checkout, cloud edition – User Management
https://d.dam.sap.com/a/UZL9HiP/06__CCO_cloud_edition_User_Management.pdf?rc=10&inline=true&doi=SAP1219894

SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition – API Access
https://d.dam.sap.com/a/kDVSuyX/05_CCO_cloud_edition_API_Access_SAP_Customer_Checkout_Manager_cloud_edition.pdf?rc=10&inline=true&doi=SAP1218854

Connect SAP Customer Checkout (POS) with SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition
https://d.dam.sap.com/a/SfEX4pb/04_CCO_cloud_edition_Connect_POS_with_SAP_Customer_Checkout_manager.pdf?rc=10&inline=true&doi=SAP1218851

entry.title: Hosting modified SAPUI5 resources
entry.content:
Hi,

We have these scenarios where we need to host OpenUI5 and/or SAPUI5 apps together with their own clones of the runtime repositories:

  1. App runs in an offline network, i.e. the clients accessing it cannot reach https://ui5.sap.com/resources from where we usually provision the runtimes.
  2. Apps can deploy online to BTP as usual, but we need to modify standard libraries. Specific example is to adjust the Fiori Elements templating process beyond what is supported in the Flexible Programming Model.

For 1.) I expect the approach would involve hosting the runtimes from https://tools.hana.ondemand.com/#sapui5 together with the app.

For 2.) I expect it would involve cloning, adjusting, building and deploying https://github.com/UI5/openui5 for OpenUI5 since it is open source, but how about SAPUI5? It would also be great to only host the particular portion of the runtime which needs adjustment (e.g. sap.fe), and convenient if the hosting could still be into the HTML5 repo and still integrate with the managed launchpad.

Has anyone tried this and have guidance, samples, best practices etc. to share?

Thanks in advance!

//Carl

entry.title: Develop Analytical List Page on Cloud Platform (BTP) by using Business Application Studio
entry.content:
Inspired by @AnkurBajpai's insightful blog on 'SAP Fiori Elements – Analytical List Page', I have embarked on developing an Analytical List Page. This blog aims to expand and refine some of the details provided in Ankur's comprehensive guide.

1. Preliminary Steps

  1. To gain a foundational understanding of Analytical List Pages, refer to SAP Fiori Elements – Analytical List Page Part 1(Introduction).
  2. For creating and exposing a sample OData Service, see SAP Fiori Elements – Analytical List Page Part 2(Development of CDS view) and SAP Fiori Elements – Analytical List Page Part 3(Development of OData Service).

This blog will specifically address additional details about SAP Fiori Elements – Analytical List Page Part 4(Creation of Destinations and Analytical List Page), focusing on tools that may be unfamiliar to newcomers or possibly deprecated.

2. Cloud Connector

2.1. Install and Setup Cloud Connector
  1. Download and Install Guidance
  2. Log on to the Cloud Connector and Initial Setup 
  3. Add a subaccount: If you choose 'Configure Manually' option, then fill the following fields per those in your BTP subaccount (Login BTP Cockpit)
After setting up, homepage of your subaccount will look like this:
2.2. Create destination in SAP Cloud Connector
  1. Choose 'Cloud to On Premise', then press add icon to add one mapping. Fill the following information to setup the connection from cloud to OP, where field 'Internal Host' and 'Internal Port' can be searched from the ABAP System (in AnkurBajpai's blog it's S44, for me it's SB1) with T-code SICF.

    Detailed Instruction to display the host name of your ABAP system: Log on to your ABAP system, call transaction SICF and choose Execute (or F8). In the main menu of the headerbar, choose Goto Port Information. The information is displayed on a screen, where the HTTP port is specified under SERVICE.
  2. Click on the circled icon to check if the connection is reachable, if doesn't work, check filled values one by one. (for example, If fill 'Internal Host' with 'Host Name' doesn't work, then try fill it with the IP address.)
2.3. Create destination SAP Cloud Platform (BTP)
  1. Login your BTP trail subaccount (Login)
  2. Choose 'Create New Destination From Scratch'
  3. Fill mandatory fields and add the following properties, where field 'user' and 'password' are the one login to your ABAP system.
  4. Click on 'Check Connection' to see if it's successful.

3. Create Analytical List Report Template

3.1. Generate Project

Since SAP WEB IDE Full Stack service is no longer available in the Service Marketplace, we now use SAP Business Application Studio to create Analytical List Report Templates.

  1. Subscribe the service 'SAP Business Application Studio' in Service Marketplace.
  2. Open 'SAP Business Application Studio' in your subscribtions.
  3. Create a Dev Space (SAP Fiori) and open it when it's status turns into 'running'.
  4. Choose File--->New Project from Template
  5. Choose SAP Fiori generatorand press Startbutton
  6. Choose Analytical List Pagetemplate and press Next
  7. For Data Source and Service Selection:
  8. Entity Selection:
  9. For project attributes, keep the following attributes as they are; otherwise, you may need to configure additional settings that are beyond this exercise.
  10. Press Finishyou will see the generated project in your workspace.
3.2. Run Project
  1. Right click the webapp folder of your project and choose Preview Application
  2. Choose 'start-noflp' then your application will be opened directly without in FLP.

Okay, now all things are set up. Please keep following instructions in SAP Fiori Elements – Analytical List Page Part 4(Creation of Destinations and Analytical List Page Template) to add those UI annotations to develop your first Analytical List App.

4. Add Visual Filters by Business Application Studio (BAS)

  1. Right click webapp folder, choose 'Open Guided Development'
  2. Select your project and scoll down to 'Analytical List Page' section, then click on 'Add a new Visual Filter to the Filter Bar'.
  3. Press 'Start Guide' to follow the guidance to add one visual filter.
    Input/Choose required fields ----> Press 'Insert Snippet' button to insert generated code into the local webapp/annotation/annotation.xml file ----> Press 'Next' or 'Exit Guide' if you finished all steps.

For adding KPI in the Analytical List Page, you can also use 'Open Guided Development' tool. (In case you want to know more about SAP Fiori Tools, refer to: Using SAP Fiori Tools to Boost Your App Development )

Finally, your Analytical List Page will look like this.

entry.title: Re: IN KE5Z REPORT KRW IS NOT REPORTING CORRECTLY
entry.content:
Hi

Thank you for your query regarding the decimal position mismatch observed between Asset Accounting reports (e.g., RAABGA01) and PCA module report KE5Z for cash flow accounts in KRW.

Please note that this issue typically arises from inconsistent decimal place or currency unit handling between the Asset Module and Profit Center Accounting configuration settings, causing the figures to display incorrectly scaled in PCA reporting.

I suggest you verify the following:

  • Ensure the decimal place settings for KRW currency in SAP customizing (transaction OY04) align with your company code and controlling area settings.
  • Confirm that the controlling area and PCA configuration settings use the same currency decimal precision as Asset Accounting.
  • Check that data extraction and transfer processes from Asset Module to PCA maintain consistent scaling and currency units.
  • Investigate KE5Z report or query level settings for any additional scaling or formatting mishandling.

If these checks are correctly aligned, the PCA reports should show amounts consistent with Asset Accounting without comma or decimal displacement.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

My recommendation would be to create your FM for the BTE event, but inside the FM call an ABAP Cloud class, so that your coding is as close to ABAP Cloud and to what it would be, once local consumption is available in your system. Hope that helps.

BR, Melanie

entry.title: Re: Re Print Customer Invoices in Mass
entry.content:
Hi @Dean_Wealleans  

Thank you for your question

Please note, to efficiently handle requests for multiple invoices within a time frame, against a statement, or for specific sales orders, you can use SAP transaction VF31 (Output Processing for Billing Documents). VF31 allows selection of multiple billing documents based on your criteria and supports mass reprinting or emailing of invoices.

Here is my suggested approach:

  • Enter the output type for invoice print or email.
  • Filter invoices by customer, date range, or related sales orders.
  • Execute and select all relevant invoices.
  • Trigger mass print or send by email.

For SAP S/4HANA Cloud or Fiori environments, similar functionality is available via the Print Invoice or Manage Billing Documents apps, or you can leverage the SAP Cloud Print Manager for bulk document processing.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Chris

entry.title: Re: Quantity Scales determination in the multi payee cond...
entry.content:
To drive your multi-payee scale determination on the total quantity—while still settling each payee on their individual volume—you need to:

  • Transfer the aggregated total quantity into the settlement document
  • Base your scale routine on that transferred total quantity
  • Keep your settlement calculation itself on the individual volumes

With the below configuration pattern, it should work for you.

In SPRO navigate to Sales & Distribution → Settlement Management → Condition Contract → Business Volume Profile. Open your profile, go to the Business Volume Selection Criteria tab. Add a new entry (or edit existing) for Total Business Volume Quantity: – Business Volume Condition = RBVT (Total Business Volume) – Transfer to Settlement = X – Subtotal = 5. This flags that, on settlement, SAP must copy the sum of all volumes (qty) into the settlement document’s RBVT item.

In OPL8 (or COR4 → Pricing Procedure) copy your base procedure (e.g. KZ0) to a Z-procedure. Insert RBVT as a condition type at Subtotal 5. Make sure your settlement condition (RES1 or your Z-equivalent) sits after RBVT.

On RES1 (or your Z-settlement type) set Scale Routine = 02 in condition–type definition. Routine 02 reads the resident subtotal (RBVT at subtotal 5) and picks the correct scale break based on that. If your system release lacks routine 02 for quantities, copy it in VOFM → Sizing Routines and adjust the table logic to handle KOMK-KNUME (quantity) instead of KOMK-KNUMH (amount).

You run settlement for your condition contract (0S02) → system builds an SD billing‐type settlement doc. RBVT carries in the grand total qty across all payees. RES1’s scale‐routine 02 determines the scale break (e.g. 0–1,000 pcs → 2%; 1,001–5,000 pcs → 3%; etc.) based on that RBVT qty. Each individual line uses its own individual business volume to calculate its final rebate value (scale % × each payee qty).

entry.title: Re: Certified PDF in VIM
entry.content:
Hi @TriptiKaushik 

Thank you for your question.

SAP VIM supports attaching multiple related documents to a single invoice, including image files (JPG) and PDF files such as certified PDFs. These attachments are linked in the invoice processing lifecycle and stored in the document archive using ArchiveLink or an integrated content management system.

To ensure the certified PDF is captured as an attachment, please confirm your inbound document channels and processing configurations correctly recognize and classify this file along with other invoice documents.

The below links provides you with real case scenario and a video guidance.

How to auto-generate PDF attachment to invoice

SAP Central Invoice Management - Receive invoices via E-mail

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: ABAP Question : Updating LFM1-SPERM Based on LFA1-SPERQ in BP Transaction (S/4HANA)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm working with transaction BP in S/4HANA, and I need to update the field LFM1-SPERM based on the value passed in LFA1-SPERQ.

Here’s what I’ve tried so far:

  • BAdI: CVI_DEFAULT_VALUES
    This gets triggered before the save, so it doesn't have the final values yet. Also, the structure BUT000 doesn't include the SPERQ field, so it's not helpful in this case.

  • BAdI: VENDOR_ADD_DATA
    This one looks promising because it provides useful parameters (LFA1 importing and LFM1 changing). However, it doesn’t seem to trigger when I click Save in transaction BP.

  • BAdIs starting with BUPA*
    These don’t have any changing parameters, so I assume it's not safe or appropriate to modify standard tables like LFM1 within them.

My constraints:

  • I need to access a field that is not part of BUT000 (i.e., SPERQ from LFA1).

  • I cannot call cl_md_bp_maintain=>maintain directly, as I can't perform a commit inside it.

Does anyone know of a suitable BAdI, enhancement spot, or another approach to achieve this?
Any suggestions or best practices are welcome.

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Re: Date Time as a Custom Filter Field
entry.content:
Hi Gagan,

as far as I have understood your problem, there is a difference of timezones of timestamps being sent by a odata request.

What does your backend interpret, or in what timezone is shown when using timestamps coming from your frontend?

You could convert timestamp on frontend side to UTC, makes sense if your backend expects it.
On backend side, you also could convert imcoming timestamps to UTC also if needed.

Yours,
Thomas

entry.title: Re: Custom Fiori app displays placeholder instead of actu...

@walkerist79 

SmartTable basically shows table columns based on UI annotations. You only need to specify the entitySet like the example below:

			<smartTable:SmartTable id="LineItemsSmartTable" entitySet="LineItemsSet" smartFilterId="smartFilterBar" tableType="Table" enableExport="true" beforeExport="onBeforeExport" useVariantManagement="true" useTablePersonalisation="true" header="Line Items" showRowCount="true" persistencyKey="SmartTableAnalytical_Explored" enableAutoBinding="true" class="sapUiResponsiveContentPadding" enableAutoColumnWidth="true" editTogglable="true" app:useSmartToggle="true">
				<!-- layout data used to make the table growing but the filter bar fixed -->
				<smartTable:layoutData>
					<FlexItemData growFactor="1" baseSize="0%"/>
				</smartTable:layoutData>
			</smartTable:SmartTable>

entry.title: DB2 11.5 LUW - HADR rebuild from online backup ?
entry.content:
Hello,

I am currently upgrading an IBM AIX OS based DB2 system. It was DB2 V9.7 at the start and therfore requires the HADR configuration to be rebuilt based on the IBM DB2 upgrade documentation on the process. 

The SAP ERP EHP5 database is 10TB in size , therefore a significant amount of time would be required to take an offline backup to the shared storage and then use that backup to rebuild the HACMP secondary database.

I've been searching the last few days on the possibility of using an online backup of the production primary database to avoid extended downtime, but almost all the hits I've found indicate offline backup is used. I found very few with online, but these posts looked like a small test type database was used for the example. 

Has anyone got any pointers on the best way to build a heavily used productive ERP DB2 HADR primary to the secondary with an online backup - or will the offline be the way - keeping the primary production SAP system down untill the HADR starts are done after the restore completes on the secondary HADR host.

Regards,

Brian.

entry.title: Re: Date Time as a Custom Filter Field
entry.content:
Hi Thomas,

Let me give you an example of my problem.

Let’s say I have a filter field on the List Report page of my application named "Start Date Time", which accepts date-time input from the user. Now, when I select a date like 2025-08-07 00:00:00, the actual value sent in the OData request is:

 

$filter=startDateTime eq 2025-08-06T18:30:00.000Z

This happens because I'm in the IST timezone (UTC+5:30), and the browser automatically adjusts the time to UTC when sending the request.

However, my backend service expects the value to be in UTC without any timezone offset manipulation — it expects exactly 2025-08-07T00:00:00Z.

So this mismatch leads to incorrect filtering of records because the time shifted by 5.5 hours causes the backend to fetch results for the previous day.

What I want:

I’d like to override the behavior of the filter bar such that when the user selects a date and time, it is converted to UTC manually and sent exactly in the expected format — like 2025-08-07T00:00:00Z.
You can connect me in Teams (gagan.prajapati@sap.com)
Thanks,
Gagan

entry.title: SAP 分析云建模扩展与集成 2025 QRC3 版本新功能速览
entry.content:
目的   

尊敬的 SAP 社区同事：   

在 2025 年 QRC3 版本（BDC中的 SAC建模模块）中，我们为您带来了一系列重磅更新，功能焕然一新！

温馨提示：QRC3 版本将于八月中旬在您的客户端正式上线，以下内容为您抢先揭秘新功能亮点，敬请期待！ 

功能总览   

本次更新为您带来三大核心能力，详情如下：   

  1. 全新公式：WAVG（加权平均值）   
  2. FIRST、LAST 与 AVERAGE 支持含无值数据的异常聚合 
  3. 数据导出 API —— 增量聚合（Delta Aggregation） 

1.全新公式：WAVG（加权平均值）   

WAVG（加权平均）公式现已上线建模器。该公式可根据指定权重成员的对应值，计算某一成员的加权平均值，适用于标准模型和账户模型。 

加权平均计算方式： 

Dimension  

Price 

Stock 

Price * Stock 

Bread 

2 

10 

20 

Bread 

3 

20 

60 

Bread 

4 

30 

120 

Total 

8 

60 

200 

表 1：含产品、价格与库存数据的示例表   

表 1 列出若干产品及其单价与库存量。 

要计算平均价格，请使用以下公式计算： 

(2 + 3 + 4) / 3 = 3 

要计算加权平均价格，请使用以下公式计算： 

(2*10) + (3*20) + (4*30) / (10 + 20 + 30) = 200 / 60 = 3.33 

通过引入权重，加权平均计算能更精准地反映实际价值。 

语法：   

WAVG([度量值] 或 [账户成员], [指定权重], [维度1], [维度2], ..., [维度10]) 

示例：   

图 1：WAVG 语法示例   

上述 WAVG 公式以 [Volume] 作为权重，计算在给定 [Date] 和 [Product] 维度下的 [Price] 加权平均值。   

WAVG 公式最多可引用 10 个维度。   

注意：目前仅支持在层次结构的叶节点（最低层级）对该计算度量进行输入。后续版本计划扩展至其他层级的成员。 

2.FIRST、LAST 与 AVERAGE 支持含无值数据的异常聚合 

新增三种异常聚合方式，现可在单一维度下，对基础度量或基础账户进行 FIRST、LAST 以及 AVERAGE 计算，并包含无值数据： 

  • Average incl. Unbooked计算所选期间内所有聚合值（含无值数据）的平均值。   
  • First incl. Unbooked返回所选期间内最早（时间最靠前）的值，包含无值数据。   
  • Last incl. Unbooked  返回所选期间内最新（时间最靠后）的值，包含无值数据。 

图 2：建模器中新增的异常聚合选项 

这些异常聚合方式同时支持标准模型与账户模型，可在聚合数据时给出更精确的结果。 

【示例】“Average including unbooked” 异常聚合： 

图 3：示例说明“Average incl. Unbooked”如何将期间内的所有月份纳入计算，而非仅含有值数据的月份   

在上例中，对某一基础度量应用了“Average incl. Unbooked”异常聚合。各季度合计：Q1 为 100，Q2 为 200，Q3 为 300，Q4 为 400。   

仅考虑有值数据时，平均值是这些值的总和，除以有值条目的数量，即 

(100 + 200 + 300 + 400) ÷ 4 = 250   

考虑含无值数据时，期间共 12 个月全部纳入计算，得到更精确的平均异常聚合，即   

  (100 + 200 + 300 + 400) ÷ 12 ≈ 83.33 

【示例】“First incl. Unbooked” 异常聚合： 

图 4：示例展示“First incl. Unbooked”如何将期间所有月份纳入计算，而非仅含有值数据的月份   

图 4 通过对比说明：使用“First incl. Unbooked”异常聚合时，系统会考虑首月无值数据值；而传统“First”聚合仅返回有值数据的首个值。   

即使二月已有数据，顶层仍显示无值数据值，因为公式已将一月（无数据）纳入计算，从而为该期间内的“First”异常聚合提供更精确的结果。 

图 5：示例说明“Last incl. Unbooked”如何在给定期间内把无值数据纳入“最后值”计算   

图5展示了“Last incl. Unbooked”与“Last（仅含有值数据）”两种聚合方式的差异。在传统“Last”模式下，10 月已有有值数据 400，且它是最后一个含有值数据的期间，因此 400 被带到层级顶层并显示出来。而“Last incl. Unbooked”同样把 10 月的 400 纳入计算，但最后一个期间是 12 月，该月存在无值数据。由于该无值数据也被视为有效，12 月的数据被推送至顶层，从而得到更贴近真实情况的 Last 聚合结果。 

3.数据导出 API —— 增量聚合（Delta Aggregation） 

数据导出 API 现已扩展，新增 “FactDataAggregation” 端点，支持将已聚合的事实数据增量导出。   

这意味着，系统可先把发生变动的事实数据聚合，再仅导出这些聚合结果，而无需导出所有变动明细。该功能与 S/4 使用聚合事实数据的方式相辅相成。   

建模者也可在模型的 “API Subscriptions” 标签页内直接访问此功能。 

图 6：在模型的“创建订阅”区域中显示的“事实数据增量聚合”实体集   

增量聚合示例： 

Account 

Product 

Sales 

Account1 

Water 

100 

Account1 

Juice 

150 

Account2 

Water 

200 

Account2 

Juice 

150 

表2：Account1与Account2包含产品及销售额。 

表2显示，Account1和Account2共包含2种产品，每种产品在不同期间的销售金额各异。 

Account 

Sales 

Account1 

250 

Account2 

350 

表3：Account1 和 Account2的聚合值   

接下来，我们对两个账户的销售额进行调整： 

Account 

Product 

Sales 

Account1 

Water 

110 

Account1 

Juice 

80 

Account2 

Water 

75 

表4：销售额已发生变动，体现为事实数据更新 

Account1中“Water”的销售额由 100 调整为 110   

Account1中“Juice”的销售额由 150 调整为 80   

Account2中“Water”的销售额由 200 调整为 75   

Account2中“Juice”的销售额保持不变   

由此重新计算得到的聚合事实数据如下： 

Account 

Sales 

Account1 

((110 - 100) + (80 - 150)) = -60 

Account2 

((75-200) + (150 – 150)) = -125 

表5：聚合值的计算方式 

这些值即为通过“FactDataAggregation”端点，或在模型的 “API Subscriptions”中使用“Fact Data Delta Aggregation”实体集后，将要导出的聚合结果。 

结论   

总之，作为 2025 年 QRC3 版本的一部分，SAC（Business Data Cloud 模块）在“建模扩展”与“集成”领域推出了以下新功能与更新： 

    1.新增 WAVG 公式：可按对应权重成员的值，计算某成员的加权平均。   

    2.三种新的异常聚合方式   

  • First incl. Unbooked：在选定期间内，返回最早值（含无值数据）。   
  • Last incl. Unbooked：在选定期间内，返回最新值（含无值数据）。   
  • Average incl. Unbooked：在选定期间内，返回所有聚合值的平均（含无值数据）。 

    3.数据导出API 扩展：新增 “FactDataAggregation” 端点，支持将事实数据的“聚合增量”导出；建模者也可在模型的 API Subscriptions 标签页中，使用全新的 “Fact Data Delta Aggregation” 实体集。 

 

如有任何疑问，欢迎在下方留言，或前往SAC问答论坛发帖提问。

想进一步了解 FastTrack 与季度发布周期（QRC）的详情，请查阅相关 SAP 知识库文章。

更多产品资讯、最佳实践与社区资源，请访问SAC社区页面。

如需查看 2025 年 QRC 各租户的具体更新日期，可参考《SAP Analytics Cloud 季度发布周期（QRC）2025 租户更新时间表》。

想提前了解即将推出的新功能，欢迎浏览 SAP Road Map Explorer。

感谢阅读！

entry.title: Re: SD: Rounding differences in invoicing
entry.content:
Even though 35 000 × 9 % = 3 150.00 exactly, SAP SD can still show 3 149.98 on each item when creating the invoice. This is by design, not a system bug, and is caused by how SAP rounds “group” vs. “item” conditions and distributes header-level values to line items.

What is happening in your cause is that

  • You’ve got a surcharge condition type (say, ZA09) that’s marked as both an item and group condition in V/06.
  • At item processing, SAP calculates the surcharge per line: – 35 000.00 × 9 % = 3 150.00 ➔ rounded to 2 decimals = 3 150.00
  • Because it’s a group condition, SAP then: – Adds up all line net values (6 × 35 000 = 210 000), calculates 210 000 × 9 % = 18 900.00 – Distributes that 18 900.00 back to the 6 lines – During distribution the system must split and round each share (18 900.00 ÷ 6 = 3 150.00, but distribution logic yields 3 149.98 on most lines and 3 150.12 on one line)
  • The first time you look at the item lines, you see the pure item-level 3 150.00. But once you enter the header conditions, SAP re-runs the group calculation & distribution, so your items jump to the “distributed” values (3 149.98) and the tiny rounding variance shows up.

If you don’t need header-level distribution, simply uncheck Group Condition on your surcharge in V/06. Now every line is calculated and rounded in isolation—no distribution, no variance.

SAP Note 80183 describes ways to minimize rounding variances by using formula routines 919/920 on all pre-net discount/surcharge conditions, ensuring SAP rounds at the point you choose (item vs. header) Follow the note’s “Variant 2” or “Variant 3” recommendations if you have complex multi-condition pricing.

entry.title: Re: Why does admin.eu1.gigya.com point to US1 load balancer?
entry.content:
Hi @alemasetto ,

All Admin endpoints are routed through us1 data center, which has always been the main data center for these services. This setup has been in place since the beginning and it makes sense since us1 is the primary hub in the au1-eu1-us1 cluster, so having the endpoints served from the “master” location ensures stability and consistency.

Also worth noting:
Admin endpoints don’t interact with personal account data, so there’s no conflict with GDPR compliance. Everything’s designed with privacy and security in mind. 

Hope this is helpful.

Regards,
Anand Raj

entry.title: Navigation Issue in CAP UI5 Apps on BTP CF Fiori Launchpad After Page Refresh
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are building several CAP-based UI5 applications deployed on BTP Cloud Foundry.

When these applications run inside the Fiori Launchpad (FLP), we encounter a navigation issue: if a user refreshes the page explicitly, they are unable to navigate back using either the browser’s back button or the Launchpad’s NavBack button (next to the SAP home icon). Initially, the user remains stuck on the current page (the browser hash doesn’t change either). After a few clicks, they are suddenly redirected straight to the FLP home page.

There are no errors/warnings/info in the browser's console log.

This issue does not occur when the same UI5 apps are run in standalone mode (accessed via the HTML5 Applications tab in the BTP Cockpit), nor does it affect Fiori Elements apps running in FLP.

Here’s how we handle navigation and routing in our UI5 app view controllers (TypeScript):

Navigating Forward

// params are routing parameters such as mandatory parameter
public navToView(viewName: string, params?: object): void {
    this.getRouter().navTo(viewName, params ? params : {});
}

Example usage:

public onNavToNextView(): void {
    this.navToView("nextView");
}

We even added a nav back button, but it has the same problem as well.

Navigating Back

// same, params is just an obj for routing parameters
public navBackToView(viewName: string, params?: object): void {
    const history = History.getInstance();
    const previousHash = history.getPreviousHash();

    if (previousHash !== undefined) {
        window.history.go(-1);
    } else {
        this.getRouter().navTo(viewName, params ? params : {}, true);
    }
}

Example usage:

// press event for nav back button
public onNavBack(): void {
    this.navBackToView("previousView");
}

This is how we initialise the router in the Component.ts file:

this.getRouter().initialize();

This is the routing configuration in the manifest.json file:

"routing": {
      "config": {
        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",
        "controlAggregation": "pages",
        "controlId": "app",
        "transition": "slide",
        "type": "View",
        "viewType": "XML",
        "path": "myapp.view",
        "async": true,
        "bypassed": {
          "target": "notFound"
        }
      },
      "routes": [
        {
          "name": "RouteHome",
          "pattern": ":?query:",
          "target": ["TargetHome"]
        },
        {
          "pattern": "login",
          "name": "login",
          "target": "login"
        }
      ],
      "targets": {
        "TargetHome": {
          "id": "Home",
          "name": "Home",
          "level": 1
        },
        "login": {
          "viewName": "Login",
          "viewId": "login",
          "level": 1
        },
        "notFound": {
          "id": "notFound",
          "name": "NotFound",
          "transition": "show"
        }
      }
    }

 

Are we missing something in our implementation? We’ve followed UI5 examples from the Demo Kit. Could this be a known or unknown issue/bug with FLP itself?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: EF5008 No special G/L acct defined for acct type D sp...
entry.content:
When you post a down-payment via F-29, SAP uses your customizing in FBKP/OBXR to look up the correct vendor‐reconciliation (down-payment) G/L account automatically. However, with BAPI_ACC_DOCUMENT_POST, the BAPI doesn’t always call the same “pick‐up” logic—unless you explicitly provide either:

  • The special G/L reconciliation account in your BAPI‐input tables, or
  • The correct customizing entries that the BAPI actually reads.

If neither is found, you get the error - No special G/L acct defined for acct type D sp.G/L ind. A recon.acct (Message F5 008)

In FBKP, set up Offsetting entries in Special G/L transactions for Account Type = D (Vendor), Special G/L Indicator = A (Down Payment) and enter your vendor‐reconcil. account here.

The other alternate is Alternate reconciliation via OBXR. In OBXR, ensure your Special G/L indicator A is mapped to the correct reconciliation account for each vendor‐account group or company code. This is the fallback the standard GUI uses—BAPI only reads OBXR if you leave the recon‐account blank in your input. If either FBKP or OBXR customizing is missing or incomplete, F-29 will still work (it can pull from the vendor master), but the BAPI will choke.

So in summary, to fix your issue,
ensure FBKP/OBXR Customizing where you have to define the down‐payment reconcil. G/L account for Account Type D & Indicator A.
populate or override via BAPI where you need to include RECON_ACCOUNT in your ACCOUNTRECEIVABLE/PAYABLE table and mark it in the X‐structure.

entry.title: Re: Transport the service Catalogue Issue
entry.content: It seems you're having trouble creating a transport for the C_GLACCOUNTHIERARCHYNODE_SRV service in transaction /n/IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE, even after accepting the standard warning message. The most likely cause is a missing authorization or an issue with your system's transport configuration (STMS). You should ask your Basis team to verify that your user has the necessary permissions to create transport requests and that your system has a valid transport route configured. This will likely resolve the issue by enabling the pop-up where you can assign the service to a transport.

entry.title: Re: Unify ECC and NetWeaver HCM during the S/4HANA conver...
entry.content:
Hello Anderson,

 

If you want to unify two systems into one, the recommended approach is selective data transition. You can choose to do this either all at once or step by step. For example, you could first convert your ECC system to SAP S/4HANA, and then selectively move your HCM system into the new SAP S/4HANA.

To learn more about this transition path, please review this information: https://support.sap.com/en/offerings-programs/support-services/data-management-landscape-transformation/selective-data-transition-engagement.html

 

Regards,

Jose M.

entry.title: ​Advanced Developing Skills to Build a Custom Mobile Apps for Warehouse Management
entry.content:
Chapter 1: Define the Purpose 

This guide helps Warehouse Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition partners and customers to build custom mobile applications by integrating the Warehouse Task and Warehouse Order (A2X) API (from SAP Business Accelerator Hub) with SAP Build Code. 

Previously, we published a step-by-step guide blog detailing the development process for a sample mobile application.
（A Step-by-Step Guide to Build a Custom Mobile Apps for Warehouse Management Using SAP Build Code：https://community.sap.com/t5/supply-chain-management-blog-posts-by-sap/a-step-by-step-guide-to-build-a-custom-mobile-apps-for-warehouse-management/ba-p/14155800）

This follow-up article will highlight key features and advantages of the SAP Build Code-Mobile Develop Kit that enhance development, including: 

  • Use the built-in "Actions" to quickly generate a REST request. 
  • Debugging methods for mobile applications. 
  • Joule AI co-development, with examples of automated code assistance to accelerate the development process. 

 

Chapter 2: Use Actions with JavaScript 

This chapter introduces key points for using Actions to create and send a REST request. Actions are a set of built-in instructions in SAP Build Code. They enable you to control mobile application behaviors such as navigation, messaging, document opening, and other behaviors using visual no-code or low-code methods. Additionally, they support generating instructions for sending requests via REST services. For a detailed tutorial, you can refer to this guide. 

SendRequest - Mobile Development Kit References 
Step to create a REST Action: 

1.Right-click the Actions folder in the file directory of the project and select "MDK: New Action". 

 2. Choose "REST Service Send Request" and click "Next". 

 3. You can configure your service URL and additional properties here. "Success Action" and "Failure Action" refer to the actions to be taken after the request succeeds or fails, respectively. 

 4. The obtained result can be retrieved via actionBinding, and further operations can be performed on it. 
Using example in previous Blog: （A Step-by-Step Guide to Build a Custom Mobile Apps for Warehouse Management Using SAP Build Code：https://community.sap.com/t5/supply-chain-management-blog-posts-by-sap/a-step-by-step-guide-to-build-a-custom-mobile-apps-for-warehouse-management/ba-p/14155800）

Set the "Target" of the action to the rest request for getting warehousetask： 

{{TestServerURL}}/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_warehouse_order_task_2/srvd_a2x/sap/warehouseorder/0001 

Then the returned warehousetask information will be as shown in the figure below.  

 

Next, we can create a Rule use the following example code. 

Example code: 

export default function ShowWarehouseTask(clientAPI) { 

  alert(JSON.stringify(clientAPI.getActionBinding())); 

}

Last step, bind the "Success Action" of the send request action to this rule file. This means that if the request returns a success, this successful rule will be triggered. We can then bind this action to the button on the page and click it to trigger it (for specific methods, refer to the previous blog).

 

 

Chapter 3: Tracing API Request in Mobile App 

For tracing request and returned information sent in mobile app. 

1. Open the mobile service on the storyboard, which can be found in Quick Access. 

 2. Scroll down to the bottom of the "Add on Features" section. If the "Network Trace" option is not visible, click the nearby "Add Feature" button to enable it. 

 3. After clicking ​​"Start Recording"​​, use the mobile app to send requests. The log will capture all network requests. After downloading the ​​recording​​, view the request status, response values, and other details ​​to analyze the issue​​. 

 

 

Chapter 4: Joule Example: Using Joule AI to Accelerate Development 

Joule AI integrated into this web-based compiler enhances rapid development. 

However, ​​for complex actions​​, its generated code may lack precision or executability, requiring manual inspection and refinement. ​​For simpler actions and UIs​​, Joule significantly accelerates development—​​the clearer your language descriptions​​, ​​the more tailored content Joule generates​​. 

​​Key commonly used commands include:​ 

1. /mdk-gen-action 
Automatically generates action configurations and embeds them into mobile service files. These actions can be bound to UI elements (e.g., buttons) to trigger workflows—such as navigation, message prompts, or REST API calls (e.g., GET/POST). 

2. /mdk-gen-page 
Generates UI pages based on OData entity metadata or custom requirements. 

You may also use /help to discover other available features.  

 

​Usage Example​​: Taking the use of the Cancel Warehouse Task Request in the WOWT API as an example, we need to use the Joule function to generate action code and UI interfaces. 

Input in Joule： 

"I need a 'send request' action to send a POST request to:   

{{starturl}}/sap/opu/odata4/.../WarehouseTask(   

  EWMWarehouse='{{whse}}',   

  WarehouseTask='{{wt}}',   

  WarehouseTaskItem='{{wt_item}}'   

)/SAP__self.CancelWarehouseTask?sap-client={{client}}   

Headers:   

- If-Match: *   

- X-CSRF-Token: {{csrf_token}}"

 

For UI Creation: 

/mdk-gen-page #your_service  

"Generate a form page with:   

Text input fields for:   

   - Warehouse Task ID   

   - Warehouse Item ID   

   - Warehouse Location   

A confirmation button labeled 'Cancel Task'"

Output: 

Next, you only need to make simple modifications to quickly generate a cancel warehouse task request page. 

 

 

Conclusion   

This guide introduces some advanced usage methods of SAP Build Code as well as distinctive tools that are different from those in other development approaches, etc. The main content includes: 

  • Using built-in tools "Actions" to simplify REST API integration. 
  • Debugging network requests directly in the app. 
  • Leveraging Joule AI to speed up basic code and UI creation. 

It is hoped that these advanced methods can be helpful to you when developing mobile apps for our API in Warehouse Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

entry.title: Rollup Hierarchy Issue
entry.content:
Hello Community !
In the rollup hierarchy, I manually checked around 60 planners after a time-consuming task, as there was no other way to do it. I saved the changes and successfully launched the worksheets. However, when I tried to relaunch the worksheets a second time—after deleting them—I noticed that 0 worksheets were created.

After investigating, I was surprised to find that none of the planners were checked anymore. I'm wondering if this issue occurs occasionally, and what might be the reason behind it.

Thank you
